body.name: Garmin Dash Cam Mini 2, Tiny Size, 1080p and 140-degree FOV, Monitor Your Vehicle While Away w/ New Connected Features, Voice Control (Renewed)

body.description: Tiny camera, huge protection. The car key-sized Garmin Dash Cam Mini 2 with voice control (only available in English, German, French, Spanish, Italian and Swedish) automatically records 1080p video and provides discreet eyewitness incident detection. Notice: Some jurisdictions regulate or prohibit use of this device. It is your responsibility to know and comply with applicable laws and rights to privacy in jurisdictions where you plan to use this device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, is small and simple
reviews.reviewText: I decided to take a risk with a refurbished model instead of new because it was a decent bit cheaper, and I'm quite impressed. The dashcam looks and works like new. Very easy to set up and use. Video and picture quality isn't the best but it's good enough to make out some details and isn't too bad overall. The view angle is very wide, so there's a lot to see in the shot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Most have at all times
reviews.reviewText: Most have at all times, everyone should get a dash cam in their vehicle at once without amy hesitation, in more than one occasion this has saved me from being wrongfully accused of an accident,About this particular dashcam, it's garmin and it's great value and quality, it works perfectly and it's size is perfect as I hate things taking space in my windshield, great stability and perfect night vision, it connects fine as long as you don't have other devices connected in the vehicle at the same time, if you do may have to temporarily disconnect them in order to connect to your dashcam other than knowing that, it's perfect.Definitely recommend it..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars App is a little finiky
reviews.reviewText: I use a Pixel 7 Pro which definitely has an issue connecting to the app. The camera itself is very very very good quality and when you remove the sim card and put it into your computer there are no problems. The problem I had was viewing videos in the app. It takes ages to load almost 15 mins. Setting up the camera was easy though. It also sends notifications when parking mode is engaged. However, if I just grab something from my car and don't start it, parking mode gets set off. other than these hiccups it's a good camera

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really love Garmin dash cams they work great and are easy to set up and retrieve videos from, It has the Garmin app which makes retrieving videos super easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stops recording videos after a while
reviews.reviewText: I have three cars and I've gotten two generic A119 cameras and never had any problems. They don't have a lot of bells and whistles, like an app that can connect to the camera and view/download the videos, but they've dependably recorded without issues. I got the Garmin for my Porsche, I wanted to be able to view videos on my phone rather than having to take an SD card out and view it on a computer. Even though the generic cameras had no issues, I felt the Garmin would be a more reliable option since it was for my more expensive car. Boy was I wrong, the Garmin worked fine for two months and then would intermittently record. The camera comes on, shows the red light indicating its recording and I can even connect to it, but it won't record videos from some 75% of the the drives unless I manually tell it to record (the manual recording is only meant to record short clips). I went to Garmin's site and followed all the directions to fix this issue, this mainly entails formatting the SD card and making sure the camera is plugged in. Nothing has helped. The worst part of this is that the entire time I thought I was protected in the event there was an accident and here this camera was not doing anything. I am just glad I discovered the issue before something happened. I'm going to go back to the old dependable A119s, the Garmin is garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect low profile dash cam
reviews.reviewText: I have been searching for the perfect dash cam to protect myself in case of an accident. I have looked high and low for a suitable cam, but all the ones I found seemed to be big and clunky, and I was worried about someone breaking in to my truck just to steal the dash cam. The Garmin Mini Dash cam2 was the perfect size and had all the features I wanted. To start with, this cam is very small and when mounted, you have to really look to see it. It takes outstanding video in Hi-Def, and I paired it with a 128GB Micro SDXC card, so I know I have plenty of space to record. I also installed a Dongar direct connect adaptor, so I plug the power in to the power outlet of my rear-view mirror (yes, I didn't know that was there either). This means you don't have to have an unsightly power cable or the headaches of trying to tuck the cord around the perimeter of the windshield. There isn't a screen on this cam since it is so small, but you can easily pair your Mini Cam2 with your phone via the Garmin app. The video will stun you with the definition and quality of the video.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Overall a good dash cam, but I wish there was another way to view the footage on your phone other than connecting it to your phone with bluetooth while using wifi. The only way I can see the footage is if I'm sitting in my car close enough to the house where I can use the wifi from inside. But overall it has been good at capturing those moments when I have to brake harder than usual, and I like that it's small and inconspicuous and doesn't block my view. The video quality is good enough for my needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been wanting a dash cam for a while, but couldn’t pull the trigger until I found this on sale. I’ve used Garmin products for years and can say that this is just as simple to use and as reliable as I can expect from Garmin. Installation was a breeze as well! Definitely look into the OBD adapter as well.I love it and highly recommend it.
Buena resolución y fácil de instalar

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent app and quality of camera - wifi is wonky
reviews.reviewText: It took a bit of work to get this working on my Garmin Drive app. I had to find troubleshooting instructions online and follow them exactly. When you have Wireless CarPlay in your vehicle, you have to do some extra work to disable that functionality first.The camera itself is discrete but I wish there was a way to turn the Wifi on it on/off so it wouldn’t cause occasional signal issues in your vehicle.

My only real complaint is that the 6 inch wire has the micro usb in the wrong direction, that's why I deducted a star. I had to use the super long wire for a 4 inch run. I had no issues getting the app to work. The red record light is a bit intense in your face when driving at night, but I just put some black sharpie over top of it to dim it. I didn't find the adhiesve to be very good so I replaced it with 2 way Gorilla tape, now it's rock solid.
This is a fantastic little camera - definately the Garman quality I expected..
